	The Compliance Officer will be responsible for ensuring that the company&rsquo;s operations, investment products, and advisory services comply with applicable laws, regulations, and internal policies.
	This includes oversight of regulatory filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC Nigeria), monitoring adherence to investor protection guidelines, and&nbsp;promoting a strong culture of compliance across the organization.

Regulatory Compliance


	Ensure the company complies with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations issued by SEC Nigeria, NAICOM (if insurance-linked products), NSE, and other regulatory bodies.

	Prepare, review, and submit statutory filings with SEC Nigeria, including:
	Periodic returns (monthly, quarterly, and annual filings).
	Registration, renewal, and update filings for funds, schemes, and investment products.
	Compliance certificates and reports in line with SEC rules and regulations.
	Reporting of significant shareholding changes, corporate actions, or other mandated disclosures.
	Maintain proper documentation and record-keeping for all filings and correspondence with the SEC Nigeria.

	Oversee Know-Your-Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) processes, ensuring compliance with CBN and SEC AML/CFT guidelines.
	Monitor investment portfolios and trading activities to detect and prevent market abuse, insider trading, and conflicts of interest.


Advisory&#39;s Training


	Advise management and staff on compliance requirements related to product development, marketing, and client engagement.
	Deliver training programs to employees on regulatory obligations, ethical conduct, and internal compliance policies.
	Provide ongoing guidance to investment, operations, and client service teams to ensure compliance integration.


Reporting&#39;s Governance


	Submit periodic compliance reports to the CEO and Board of Directors.
	Act as the primary liaison with regulators, auditors, and external counsel on compliance matters.
	Promote a culture of transparency, integrity, and ethical conduct within the organization.

	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Law, Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related discipline (Master&rsquo;s or Professional certification is an advantage).
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in compliance, legal, or regulatory affairs within an asset management, investment banking, or financial services firm.
	Strong knowledge of SEC Nigeria rules, NSE regulations, and other relevant financial market guidelines.

	High ethical standards, attention to detail, and the ability to handle confidential information


Core Competencies


	Strong regulatory knowledge and interpretation skills.
	Ability to anticipate compliance risks and recommend preventive solutions.
	Proactive engagement with regulators and stakeholders.
	Integrity, diligence, and commitment to professional excellence.

N400,000 - N500,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application

	Periodic returns (monthly, quarterly, and annual filings).

	Compliance certificates and reports in line with SEC rules and regulations.
	Reporting of significant shareholding changes, corporate actions, or other mandated disclosures.
	Maintain proper documentation and record-keeping for all filings and correspondence with the SEC Nigeria.
	Liaise with SEC officials and ensure prompt responses to regulatory inquiries, inspections, and audits.


Internal Monitoring's Controls


	Conduct periodic compliance risk assessments and internal audits to identify gaps and recommend corrective actions.
	Oversee Know-Your-Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) processes, ensuring compliance with CBN and SEC AML/CFT guidelines.
	Monitor investment portfolios and trading activities to detect and prevent market abuse, insider trading, and conflicts of interest.

	Advise management and staff on compliance requirements related to product development, marketing, and client engagement.
	Deliver training programs to employees on regulatory obligations, ethical conduct, and internal compliance policies.
	Provide ongoing guidance to investment, operations, and client service teams to ensure compliance integration.


Reporting's Governance


	Submit periodic compliance reports to the CEO and Board of Directors.
	Act as the primary liaison with regulators, auditors, and external counsel on compliance matters.
	Promote a culture of transparency, integrity, and ethical conduct within the organization.

	Bachelor’s Degree in Law, Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related discipline (Master’s or Professional certification is an advantage).

	Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.

	Strong regulatory knowledge and interpretation skills.

Job Vacancies at First Rivers Hospital Limited
content:
First Rivers Hospital Limited is a sixty bed complex located at 7/9 Old Aba Road, Rumuomasi / 250 Aba Express way Port Harcourt, with modern equipment. Through over 150 staff, 78 of which are core healthcare professionals, we are committed to the provision of compelling quality timeless medical services to our patients. Our objective is to maximally exploit medical sciences in the art of health management and preservation of life with regards to The Ultimate Intelligence.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Matron / Head Nurse

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	A leading healthcare facility in Port Harcourt is inviting applications from qualified and dynamic nursing professionals to fill the position of Matron (Head Nurse).
	This is a critical leadership role responsible for overseeing the nursing department to ensure delivery of excellent patient care, efficient staff management, and adherence to healthcare standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide strategic leadership and direction to the nursing team, fostering a culture of professionalism, empathy, and continuous improvement.
	Ensure nursing services comply with national and international healthcare regulations and hospital policies, maintaining high standards of patient safety and care.
	Develop, implement, and monitor nursing protocols, guidelines, and training programs to enhance staff competence and service quality.
	Supervise daily nursing operations including patient care, staff scheduling, inventory management, and resource allocation.
	Coordinate with multidisciplinary teams, including doctors, allied health professionals, and hospital management, to facilitate seamless healthcare delivery.
	Lead performance evaluations, conduct staff appraisals, and promote professional development among nursing personnel.
	Manage conflict resolution, disciplinary procedures, and maintain harmony within the nursing department.
	Prepare reports on nursing activities and present findings to senior management.


Qualifications and Skills


	Registered Nurse with a valid practicing license from the Nursing and Midwifery Council of Nigeria (NMCN).
	Minimum of 7 years of clinical nursing experience with at least 3 years in a supervisory or managerial role within a hospital setting.
	Bachelor of Nursing Science (B.N.Sc) or equivalent; a Master’s degree in Nursing or Healthcare Management is highly desirable.
	In-depth knowledge of healthcare policies, nursing standards, patient care methodologies, and hospital accreditation processes.
	Strong leadership, organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.
	Ability to handle high-pressure situations, make sound decisions, and solve complex problems.
	Commitment to continuous professional development and mentorship of nursing staff.


Application Closing Date: 9th September,2025.Date

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their detailed CV, a cover letter stating reasons for application and/or relevant certificates to: vacancy2@firstrivers.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) Officer

Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	An HMO Officer manages Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) related activities for a healthcare provider, focusing on patient insurance verification, claims processing, billing, and liaising with HMO representatives to ensure accurate payments and compliance with regulations.
	Key responsibilities include verifying patient benefits, obtaining service authorizations, submitting and tracking claims, coordinating with billing departments, and resolving discrepancies to ensure timely processing of payments and services.
	The role requires strong administrative, communication, and problem-solving skills, along with accuracy and attention to detail.


Key Responsibilities
HMO Liaison:


	Act as the primary point of contact between the healthcare provider and HMOs, managing communications and building strong relationships.
	Patient Verification: Confirm patient eligibility and benefits with various HMOs to ensure they are covered for services.
	Authorization & Approvals: Obtain necessary approvals from HMOs for specific medical treatments or services.
	Claims Management: Prepare, submit, and track claims with HMOs, following up on rejected or pending claims to ensure prompt payment.
	Billing & Reconciliation: Work with the billing team to ensure accurate invoicing and reconcile HMO payments, outstanding balances, and discrepancies.
	Compliance: Ensure all HMO transactions and communications adhere to regulatory requirements and hospital policies.
	Problem Resolution: Address discrepancies and issues related to claims or coverage between patients and HMOs.
	Record Keeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records, HMO information, and relevant documentation.


Key Skills and Qualifications


	Administrative Skills: Proficiency in office software, such as MS Excel, is essential for managing data and generating reports.
	Communication Skills: Strong oral and written communication skills are necessary to interact effectively with HMO representatives and patients.
	Problem-Solving Skills: The ability to resolve issues with claims, billing, and patient coverage is crucial.
	Attention to Detail: High accuracy is required to ensure the correctness of patient information, billing, and claims.
	Organizational Skills: Multi-tasking abilities are important for managing various HMO-related tasks simultaneously.
	HMO Experience: Experience in hospital billing, HMO operations, or health insurance is highly valued.


Application Closing Date: 9th September,2025.

Method of Application

Key Responsibilities


	Generate and review patient invoices for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with hospital billing procedures
	Ensure every patient receives appropriate billing and payment is processed through the cashier
	Process bills between the 1st and 4th of every month as per hospital policy
	Maintain accurate billing records and ensure correspondence with treatments provided
	Reconcile patient accounts and process complex financial transactions
	Ensure all HMO platforms are adequately followed and patients are treated according to their plans
	Handle HMO patients whose coverage requires additional authorization or private payment
	Maintain secure and accurate patient billing databases
	Serve as primary liaison between Health Maintenance Organizations (HMOs) and the hospital's medical team
	Verify patient eligibility and obtain necessary pre-authorizations from HMOs

	Follow up on unpaid claims to minimize revenue loss

	Minimum of an HND / Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field
	Professional certification in healthcare billing (preferred).


Experience:

	Experience with medical billing software, portals and HMO platforms
	Knowledge of medical terminology and ICD-10 coding system.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
	Working knowledge of Google Docs and project management tools
	Experience with billing software and electronic claims processing.


Core Competencies:


	Excellent communication and customer service skills
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
	Attention to detail and accuracy in financial transactions
	Time management and organizational skills
	Knowledge of healthcare insurance policies and regulations
	Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

Bank Teller Job at Tribest Corporate Support Limited




        
    

        
        Tribest is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Bank Teller

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Bank Teller is the primary point of contact for customers visiting the bank.
	This role is responsible for providing excellent customer service, handling financial transactions accurately and efficiently, and promoting the bank's products and services.
	The ideal candidate will be a professional, customer-focused individual with strong numerical skills and a high level of integrity.


Key Responsibilities


	Customer Service: Greet customers warmly and provide a high standard of service. Answer customer inquiries and resolve issues promptly.
	Cash Handling: Process customer transactions, including deposits, withdrawals, and cash advances, with a high degree of accuracy.
	Transaction Processing: Handle daily financial activities such as checking account balances, processing loan payments, and cashing checks.
	Product Promotion: Identify opportunities to cross-sell or refer bank products and services to customers.
	Compliance & Security: Adhere to all bank policies, procedures, and security regulations to prevent fraud and protect customer information.
	Record Keeping: Maintain accurate records of all transactions and balance the cash drawer at the end of each shift.


Qualifications


	NCE / OND / HND or its equivalent in a relevant field (e.g., Banking, Finance, Accounting, Business Administration).
	Proven experience in a customer-facing role, preferably within the banking or financial services industry.
	Strong numerical, analytical, and data entry skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	High level of integrity, trustworthiness, and attention to detail.
	Ability to work well under pressure and manage a high volume of transactions.
	Proficiency in using banking software and other relevant office tools.
